name: Riad Argan

reviews.text: This little Riad is tucked away down a little street in a fantastic location just a few minutes walk from the main square. We couldn't have asked for more from this perfect B&B. The rooms were clean & beautifully decorated. The staff were attentive & made a superb breakfast. The roof terrace was perfect in the morning & the little pool in the courtyard was much appreciated in the July heat. I would definitely return here & have recommended it to everyone.
reviews.title: Perfect Oasis
Beautiful oasis in the middle of the medina
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on here before booking we had quite high hopes but we were still overwhelmed by this place. It really is utter luxury and calm in the centre of the medina!

reviews.title: Lovely Accomodation and very quite
reviews.text: Francios gave us a map and literally told us everything we needed to know. She walked us to the square on our first morning to check we new where we were going and from then only check in with us once a day to make sure we were ok. She was so helpful throughout our stay, she booked restaurants, gave us guide prices for things so that we didn't get ripped off and even spoke directly with our hotel in the mountains to arrange our onward travel! She was amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the ivory room which is on the ground floor and even when the riad is full we heard no noise from the courtyard. The room has lots of space and is beautifully decorated. The rest of the riad is lovely too, pictures just don't do it justice!
reviews.title: amazing place

reviews.text: Breakfast is lovely, lots of little bits to try before you head out for the day. Every morning you have a different freshly baked cake each!!
reviews.title: Truly amazing!!

reviews.text: My friend and l stayed four nights at the Riad Argan. From the moment we were met by Francoise who was so helpful it made us feel completely at ease. We didn't realise how much we would enjoy our stay. Salah and Kadesha particularly were brilliant as were all the staff. Kadesha took us to a market to buy food for a meal that we would help to prepare and she showed us how make a beautiful meal. The rooms were calming, clean and tidy. Breakfast was good quality and generous continental style. Francoise helped us with our tour need and Yusef the driver was very helpful in our trip into the Atlas Mountains. The whole stay was made much greater by the staff being such good fun.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: A stunning and lovely time - a giggle per minute all round.
reviews.title: Birthday Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughters arranged this surprise trip to Marrakesh as a birthday gift and we had a wonderfull time. Riad Argan was just perfect, they could not have been more helpful and provided a wonderful oasis of calm from the madness that is Marrakesh. The riad is located right in the heart of the Medina and was the perfect location for exploring the souks and other places of interest.
reviews.title: The Calm After the Storm

reviews.text: Our hosts at Riad Argan arranged for us to be collected from the airport and also provided an excellent evening meal on our first night. The staff were friendly and attentive without being intrusive and gave us helpful advice about how to navigate the labyrinth of alleys and narrow streets of the Medina. We had a crash course in local customs and etiquette (including bartering) which was invaluable.
reviews.title: Style; Hospitality;Attention to detail

reviews.text: My highlight of the trip was visiting the Hammam, arranged at a very good rate by Francois. After a busy day exploring the city, this was the perfect way to chill out, especially as the Hammam was almost next-door to the Riad!
reviews.title: An Oasis of Calm in a Hectic City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Riad Argan has a good location and its owner and the staff are extremely helpful and caring. Rooms are very stylish and nicely decorated but also a bit small. Breakfast could be a bit more rich (no eggs for example). We would recommend this Riad due to excellent location, good service and cleanliness and nevertheless because of the lovely staff. Riad Argan gives you somehow the impression of 1001 nights.
reviews.title: Beautiful stay in beautiful Riad

reviews.text: My mother and I stayed at this beautiful riad for 4 nights before our desert tour. Francoise and her charming attentive staff could not have been friendlier and more obliging - it always felt like nothing was too much trouble. Breakfasts were absolutely divine and of much much higher quality than some of the 5 star expensive riads we later stayed at in our trip. As was the delicious dinner, which we highly recommend for peaceful calm nights on the terrace and Moroccan cooking at its best.
reviews.title: Service beyond the call of duty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our first morning we went out to explore the souks, and 10 minutes or more after leaving the riad we stopped to get our bearings. Suddenly Francoise was upon us, having clearly chased us down as we marched through the alleyways at breakneck speed - all to ask us if we had had a good first night and were alright!! I can only imagine if we hadn't stopped to check a streetsign and carried on, she may have chased us all morning through the overcrowded streets of the medina just to be courteous. That just exemplifies the kind of top notch service and human kindness the staff at the argan show their guests.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Francoise even called our tour company the day before our departure to check they knew where the riad was and to confirm all the details of our pick up - something the company director told us the next day had never before happened from any riad in Marrakech. Francoise and her entire staff go far beyond the call of duty time and time again.
reviews.title: The most helpful hosts you will ever encounter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I celebrated our Honeymoon at the Riad Argan and we cannot rate it highly enough. Marrakech is a beautiful city, bustling and vibrant with plenty to do and even more to buy! Francoise and her team at Riad Argan where the most exceptional hosts and made our stay truly memorable organising tours, dinner reservations and spas on our behalf as well as suggesting places to go and things to do.
reviews.title: A charming riad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This riad was the highlight of our trip to Marrakech. We stayed in the Pearl room, on the ground floor. it was one of the larger rooms in the riad and the bathroom was lovely, tall waterfall shower and a good mix of modern and traditional. It had a gorgeous carved ceiling and was very relaxing. On the whole the place was quiet, but we heard everyone's comings and goings as we were near the front door. Also the staff tended to talk in the kitchen area, which was close to our room. I must say, that was the only down point of the whole stay. The location, just south west of Djema el-fna square, walkable in 5 mins. We found a great restaurant near this riad if you get on to main road outside the riad and turn left, it's called Un Dejeuner a Marrakech, and we ended up going their twice in our week long stay. Another nearby place good for lunch and coffee is barakshi cafe.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly owner and pretty room

reviews.text: The riad staff will bring beer on request, mint tea And small snacks are usually lso provided, which are very tasty. The owner, Francois booked us a taxi to and from the airport, and met us from the taxi, thrn walked us to the car when we departed which made us feel very looked after. The weather was still in the high 30s when we were there and our room had brilliant air con which was very much appreciated.
reviews.title: An Elegant and Charming Oasis

reviews.text: My family of 3 stayed in two rooms for 2 nights from Aug 30- Sep 1 at Riad Argan and a third night at the related Riad Alaka from Sep 2-3. Riad Argan is truly a home away from home. Initially, we had wanted to stay at the same riad for all three nights in Marrakech. But Riad Argan was only available for the first two nights and Francoise offered the third night at Riad Alaka. We did not regret our decision. It was the top accommodation and one of the highlights of our 24 days Europe/Africa trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay!

reviews.text: Elegantly and tastefully remodeled and decorated by Francoise over a two-year period, we felt we were in a surreal and dreamy world upon our arrival in the early morning hours the first night. Riad Argan is only a few minutes walk from Jamaa El Fna. It is a relaxing and comfortable respite after venturing to the square, souqs, and museums.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Francoise saw to our every need, including arranging for a private 4x4 taxi to and from the airport, and for our overnight excursion to hike in the High Atlas Mountain in Imlil. (Our flight was delayed and we arrived at Marrakech at 3:30 am instead of 1:00 am. By the time we got our luggage and cleared immigration, it was 4:30 am. To our relief, the taxi driver was there to greet us.) Francoise provided information on the highlights of Marrakech, tips for shopping and bargaining at the souqs, and even arranged for one of the staff to purchase argan oil at the "local" price for us. The three sisters working at Riad Argan also provided excellent service. We only carried our overnight clothes in a backpack for our trek at Imlil. Francoise arranged to move our luggage to Riad Alaka and also greeted us there upon our return from Imlil.
reviews.title: Just like being at home!

description: RIAD ARGAN is situated in the heart of Marrakech one of Morocco's most important cultural centers, walking distance to the famous place jamaa El Fna.Accommodation: Three storey Riad: Ground floor: 2 bedrooms with 2 bathrooms, dinning area, living area and dipping pool. Second floor: 3 bedrooms with 3 bathrooms Third floor: a beautiful spacious roof terrace which one can enjoy the evening breeze; Our chef can prepare Moroccan dishes at your request.It's decoration and spirit will make you feel in harmony and a profound feeling of tranquility.
